sources.title: Champions de France (1938) by Willy Rozier | Row, Rivalry, and Romance on the River!
sources.description:
When Daniel Pinoche and his rowing crew hit the River Marne, their teamwork is tested by Gladys Lodje’s charm and rivalries flare. With Coach Drick cracking the whip, they must row past distractions and pull together to claim victory, proving that even in choppy waters, true champions stay afloat.

The film was part of a broader trend in French cinema at the time, which promoted health, sports, and camaraderie among youth, serving as an escapist narrative in the lead-up to WWII.

Original title: Champions de France

Director: Willy Rozier
Writers: Willy Rozier, Roger Dubourdieu

Main cast:
Georgius - Daniel Pinoche
Pierre Etchepare - Achille Bernard
André Fouché - Bob Bernard
Maurice Maillot - Jacques Allier
Myno Burney - Gladys
Milly Mathis - Céleste
Camille Bert - Coach Drick

Genres: French cinema, Comedy, Sports
Release date: December 21, 1938
Filming location: France (River Marne)


https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=UUMOQIrvVPHrt2cN14ktGA2Snw

@CultCinemaClassics

metadata.Plot: In the lead up to WWII, several escapist French films were made promoting health and sport among youth.In this one, we see the friendship of young males on a Marne river rowing team threatened by the presence of a typical femme fatale.
